title: Interpreting First Inequality
text: The first inequality is a less than or equal to symbol, $$ \leq $$, which indicates the use of a bracket for the left endpoint.
speech: The first inequality is a less than or equal to symbol,  is less than or equal to , which indicates the use of a bracket for the left endpoint.

, which indicates the use of a bracket for the left endpoint.

title: Interpreting Second Inequality
text: The second inequality is a less than symbol, <, which indicates the use of a paranthese for the right endpoint.
speech: The second inequality is a less than symbol, <, which indicates the use of a paranthese for the right endpoint.
pacedSpeech: The second inequality is a less than symbol, <, which indicates the use of a paranthese for the right endpoint.

title: Displaying Final Interval Notation
text: What is the interval notation for the inequality?
